articles.title: EMIT: NASA's Unexpected Hero in the Climate Crisis - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Since launching 16 months ago, the EMIT imaging spectrometer aboard the International Space Station has shown an ability to detect more than just surface minerals. More than a year after first detecting methane plumes from its perch aboard the International S…
articles.content:
ByJet Propulsion LaboratoryNovember 19, 2023
Flaring, in which excess natural gas is intentionally burned into the air, is one way methane is released from oil and gas facilities. NASAs EMIT mission… [+10482 chars]
